He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People

programme.title: Top Gear

On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets off on a high-altitude trek from Kathmandu, capital of Nepal, to the Forbidden City of Lo Manthang, a secretive kingdom perched high on the Tibetan plateau, on the far side of the Himalayas. On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. They're crossing the Himalayas in a small old Peugeot, a very compact old Renault, and Nepal's first (and only) home-built car.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.desc: The coral and shipwrecks found off the shores of the tropical islands, and how the different kinds of reef have given rise to a huge diversity of underwater life in the area. programme.title: Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: The effects of the region's powerful hurricanes on the islands' wildlife and the survival stories of some of the species, including how the Puerto Rican parrot almost became extinct. Offshore, lobsters head to deeper waters for refuge, while reefs benefit from the destruction.

programme.desc: Archive performances by post-punk acts including Ian Dury and the Blockheads, the Police, Simple Minds and Madness.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits Ribblehead Viaduct in the Yorkshire Dales, talks to the man who saved it from closure and tours the breathtaking stations of the Hungerbergbahn in Innsbruck.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldn't exist.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: The varied landscape of the tropical islands and the species that inhabit them, from flamingos and four-eyed fish to anteaters and cave-dwelling rodents. programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Documentary examining three landscapes in northern Scandinavia. In the mountainous highlands, cameras capture two endangered predators relying on a plentiful supply of lemmings.

programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Deep in the forest, a female bear and three cubs emerge in the sunshine after hibernation. The first priority for the mother is to find food - and quickly, or her cubs will starve.

programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Far north in Svalbard, the polar bear depends on the ice to hunt seals. But with the ice receding, it has been forced to turn its attentions to a larger, trickier prey - the walrus.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Exploring the mountains of Dhofar in Oman, where the annual Indian Ocean monsoon has helped create a lost world of waterfalls and cloud forests filled with fascinating wildlife. The programme shows green sea turtles coming ashore in their thousands, shadowed by egg-stealing foxes, as well as footage of striped hyenas doing battle with Arabian wolves. Plus, a glimpse into the lives of chameleons, honey badgers and the elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: The changes that have swept across the Arabian peninsula since the discovery of oil. Camel racing has become a hi-tech sport and the region's animals now live alongside a very modern society, but technology is also being used to protect nature. The programme reveals how dugongs are fitted with satellite transmitters and hunting falcons chase down radio-controlled planes, and follows the construction of the world's first carbon-neutral city. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise in America
programme.desc: Eric and Ern are invited back onto The Ed Sullivan Show on the same night as the Beatles, giving them an audience of more than 70 million viewers, and are also offered a three-film deal in Britain that could be their fast track to Hollywood. Featuring performances never seen before by British viewers, and interviews with many of the artists who worked with them, including Diana Rigg, Glenda Jackson and Nicholas Parsons. Presented by Jonathan Ross.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Presuming Rene is dead, Edith hunts for his will and a new husband. Meanwhile, the airmen pose as nuns and Herr Flick enlists Lt Gruber's artistic expertise in distinguishing a real painting from two forgeries. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are forced to return to their hideout at Rene's cafe following a bungled escape attempt, and Edith continues to search for a new husband. Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera star.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British send their finest French-speaking agent to say 'good moaning' to Rene and his colleagues and, dressed as a pantomime cow, the two airmen narrowly avoid being milked before going to a landing field to pick up their plane home.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren has a bad day - a convict escapes in the fog on his way to Strangeways, the blood donor van turns up at the factory, and Tony's holiday photos cause upset. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Andrew Dunn.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Twinkle and Stan spoil Petula's plans for a peaceful family Christmas, and a baby is found abandoned near the canteen. programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates historical evidence of the story of Jesus, examining his execution and his relationship with Mary Magdalene.

programme.desc: How Second World War criminal Adolf Eichmann was tracked down to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in 1961.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals

Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

Fortunately, Terry Perkins is able to stay cool and assume the role of mediator, helping to defuse the situation while Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser flounders helplessly.

Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel is criticised for a lack of progress with the investigation and she knows she must find both a murder weapon and the encryption code used to access the website. Meanwhile, when Janet's attempt to help Taisie results in a complaint, her faith in justice is tested, and both Scott and Bailey have life-changing decisions to make about their futures. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is peeling off old wallpaper on Linda's walls, but he is actually destroying Fizz' hypnotic posters..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo finds himself shrunk and then dragged inside the President's head, along with Fizz. He thinks the hamster is a little, lost boy and decides to help him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is on a camping trip but he is actually just in the city park. He mistakes Weasel for a wounded bear and tries to help him..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds himself out on the street after his landlady orders him to leave. Near to tears, he is desperate for the comforts of home again, but fortunately a scarecrow and a pair of false teeth soon come to his rescue. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An old photo album causes Bean to reminisce about the happy holidays he spent at Scout camp as a boy - and prompts him to buy a tent in a bid to recapture his childhood.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben turns his attention to one upping Gwen at Space Camp.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Flustering Mindless Woe of the Flushable Memory Wipes
programme.desc: Animated comedy. A chocolate pudding incident forces George and Harold into hiding..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes Dave on an adventure camping, but Dave isn't sure it's a great idea. He's proved right when they both wake up in a bear's cave..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James shares more highlights from the series. He prepares prawn toast and ribs and offers advice on making butter at home. Plus, recipes from Nick Nairn, Clare Smyth and Lenny Carr Roberts and a chance to see James' food tour of Norfolk.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Monica Galetti for a culinary journey around Oxford, where they pay a visit to Raymond Blanc at his restaurant Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons, and sample some of his award-winning dishes. They take a trip up the river to a farm where they pick raspberries for a pudding, and James prepares a chicken dish with morels in the grounds of Raymond's restaurant.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Amman in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. He catches up with his old friend Maria who runs a cookery school, discovers how the country is becoming a serious wine-producing region and visits a bustling fruit and vegetable market for ingredients. Ainsley's dishes include chargrilled sumac lamb cutlets with tabbouleh and falafel with hummus.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Martin Clunes narrates more tips on how to keep dogs mentally stimulated during lockdown. Cameras follow Bodie, a Jack Russell that helps children with their reading, Summer, the golden retriever with maternal urges toward rescue kittens, and a dog that howls along to a 90s club hit.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Oswestry, North Shropshire, where members of the public are invited to bring in any antiques they own or have discovered to independent experts for valuation and more importantly, for sale.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1989 Liverpool v Arsenal Title Decider - ITV Football Classic
programme.desc: Elton Welsby presents extended highlights of the memorable match at Anfield, which saw Arsenal needing to win by at least two goals to pip their opponents to the title. With analysis from Bobby Robson, reports by Jim Rosenthal and commentary from Brian Moore and David Pleat.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the eliminator round of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by to take part in a series of unusual challenges. The first episode comes from Cardiff.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes, he challenges panellists Jimmy Carr, Carol Vorderman and Kriss Akabusi to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: The World Is Not Enough (1999)
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to protect the heiress of an oil dynasty after her father is killed in a bombing at MI6 headquarters. The attack is the work of an infamous terrorist who is unable to feel pain after surviving a gunshot to his head, and who now intends to destroy the world's supply of oil. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Robert Carlyle, Sophie Marceau and Robbie Coltrane.

programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he is in the middle of a work-out at his local gym, Magoo inadvertently climbs onto a delivery boy's bicycle..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless half-wit is furious when a child blasts his model aeroplane out of the sky, and soon plots revenge _ leading to an all-out battle for airspace over London. Animated comedy, with the voices of Rowan Atkinson, Jon Glover and Sally Grace.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: One of the Queen's corgis takes a liking to Bean's teddy and runs off with it during a visit to Buckingham Palace.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Team Tennyson is saved by a toddler.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Soggy Salvation of The...
programme.desc: The boys go back in time and stop Mr Krupp from becoming a bully, turning him into something worse..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display, and Dave's bad breath wakes one of the exhibits up.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Gran accidentally wins a board game as a Bingo prize, and after being locked up for years the game has a vendetta all of its own..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Gareth Ward for a tour of Mid Wales. They begin at a cider-tasting, which James uses to dish up some cider-infused apple fritters. Gareth discovers a farm where the Wagyu cattle fed on local beer. Away from the culinary activities, Gareth is challenged to a rally car ride and James demonstrates his dog training prowess with his trusty hound Cooper.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is still in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. In the seaside city of Aqaba he uses local molasses in a fattoush salad, and cooks with the chefs at a swanky golf club, where roasted fish with spicy rice is the order of the day. Ainsley also visits the city of Petra, learning the history of the Bedouin people and exploring the astonishing Treasury building. Back in his kitchen, chicken shawarma with tahini sauce and pitta bread packed with spiced beef mince are the final dishes on the menu.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Featuring some of John Torode and Lisa Faulkner's favourite recipes from across the series, including scrambled eggs and pikelets, slow-cooked steak chilli, Goan fish skewers, instant jam, pink spaghetti, and a cake in a mug.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Kent couple Lou and Andy Webb have two young children affected by a rare genetic condition that severely restricts their eyesight, meaning they only see in black and white and have to wear special goggles in sunlight. Alan Titchmarsh's challenge is to create a more child-friendly garden for their terraced home in Tonbridge, and his first task is to make a shady environment so the kids can spend time outside in the day. After that, he and the team come up with a bespoke lighting system for the evenings, acoustic fencing to cut down the noise from a nearby railway line, and an area for the parents.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Colwyn Bay welcomes the team. Jan Keyne goes on a fishing trip for a beautiful bronze, James Layte rocks a pair of country chairs and Mark Stevens makes time for tea.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five from Essex calling themselves Showaddiwaddilove answer questions about top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Jurassic Park (1993)
programme.desc: Scientists are given a sneak preview of a safari park inhabited by genetically engineered dinosaurs created by an eccentric tycoon. However, it all goes wrong when a greedy employee sabotages the security systems, allowing the prehistoric beasts to roam free and hunt the visitors. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Richard Attenborough and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Fullers from Maidstone in Kent - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the fatal shooting of 11-year-old Rhys Jones as he walked home from football practice in Croxteth, Liverpool, caught in the crossfire of a feud between rival gangs. Detective Superintendent Dave Kelly is charged with bringing his teenage killer to justice, but though the assailant's identity is well known, finding the evidence to charge him proves to be a far more difficult challenge. Stephen Graham stars.

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: First in a two-part tribute to the comedy magician, revealing how an act that started out in the desert during the Second World War went on to take the entertainment world by storm. Narrated by Martin Clunes and featuirng contributions from famous fans including Jennifer Saunders, Simon Callow, Lionel Blair, Anita Harris, Les Dennis and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fourth episode, the three brothers track down another branch of their growing family tree, before being put through their paces in a brutal yoga session. Later, they travel to a place renowned for its spiritual enlightenment, but a therapeutic conversation takes a decidedly different turn as the brothers finally get to have their say and talk to Dougie about how they felt when he left the family home when they were children.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: Art and music event Festival No 6 draws thousands of visitors to Portmeirion, as Meurig welcomes a few famous and familiar faces and gives one of his renowned tours. Meanwhile, Mark welcomes various Michelin-starred chefs and Delyth oversees a very special wedding.

James struggles with locker-room banter and Gemma shows Chesney her vlog, but makes it clear she has no intention of putting it online after her humiliating turnstile experience.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossain puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Family and friends attend the funeral of 11-year-old Rhys Jones as he is laid to rest, while a police raid at the home of Kevin Moody leads to the recovery of the gun used in the schoolboy's murder. Moody must choose between being labelled a grass and risking violent retribution or protecting the killer and facing jail time. But an unexpected result from the forensic tests on the firearm leaves the entire investigation hanging in the balance. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Moran.

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Singer and actress Anita Harris retraces her footsteps back to the London Palladium where she worked with Tommy. Comedian Les Dennis makes an emotional trip back to Her Majesty's Theatre to remember the night he saw Tommy's final performance. Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s.

programme.desc: The second week of the cookery gameshow continues as chef Rosemary Shrager takes over as guest judge. First, she challenges the contestants to show off their knife skills as they are tasked to slice carrots into thin strips or juliennes, with three contenders being sent home after this initial round. The remaining cooks are then challenged to prepare a squid in 10 minutes, before creating a dish of their own using the freshly prepared squid in the final round.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson steps into Chris Tarrant's shoes to host the first edition of the revival of the quiz. Contestants sit in the famous chair to answer a maximum of 15 questions, hoping to win 1million and join original millionaires Judith Keppel, David Edwards, Robert Brydges, Pat Gibson and Ingram Wilcox. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how Queen Elizabeth II has mastered the art of being a monarch, both home and abroad, over her record-breaking 68-year reign. She is seen meeting world leaders such as Ronald Reagan, Mikhail Gorbachev and Donald Trump - although not all encounters go well, and the film also looks at the Queen's commitment to the Commonwealth, a personal project that has seen the old Empire transformed.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test

Drew and Julie are back and eager to improve on their catastrophic first tests, while in Blackpool, retired policeman Philip is hoping a pass will finally stop his wife telling him how to drive.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Bran F O'Byrne.

programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in the knockout tournament, hoping to win 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Scammers: Hunting the Lockdown Criminals - Tonight
programme.desc: There has been a spike in internet fraud - from fake goods and services to con artists impersonating the authorities through emails, texts, calls and even appearing at people's front doors. Paul Connolly investigates the unscrupulous crooks using the lockdown to prey on others.

programme.title: Police Tapes
programme.sub-title: The Murder of Rhys Jones: Police Tapes
programme.desc: When 11-year-old Rhys Jones was shot dead on his way home from weekly football practice in 2007, his family was left shattered and police were left with a case that seemed impenetrable. But when certain names were mentioned again and again, the police planted secret bugs in the homes of these gang members. Here, Susanna Reid gains unprecedented access to the subsequent recordings, where those responsible admit their part and the lengths they would go to cover up the crime. She also talks to Rhys's parents, Mel and Steve, about the impact of this appalling crime.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A couple of the birds are forced to fly this week when one of them becomes fed up of being treated like a doormat. It seems Tracey has had enough of visits from Dorien's gentleman callers to her home, and is equally unhappy that her sister doesn't contribute to the household finances, so she throws them both out. The pair of them are soon holed up together in Sharon's old bedsit, where they decide to take a united stand - but things are never quite that straightforward. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is brought in to investigate when a former Met police officer is stabbed to death outside a nightclub in Newcastle. The team initially suspects a crime of passion after it emerges the victim had recently rekindled his affair with his childhood sweetheart, whose husband has a history of violence. However, Vera uncovers evidence pointing to a more complex case involving inside information and the hostile takeover of a brewery. What did the deceased find out that cost him his life? Guest starring Jill Halfpenny, Christine Bottomley, Ralph Ineson and Liam Cunningham.

Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Luke Evans and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: The case of Brian Cargill, who when he divorced his wife, thought it was the end of a bad episode. However, he then found himself in a battle to save his son from her wrath.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: After being reported missing, a young couple's bodies were discovered more than 60 miles apart. Dedicated investigators set out to find their killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of self-made millionaire Buddy Parker's 26-year-old daughter Tara Swilley, who died after the carpet company owner's home was raked with gunfire by an embittered business associate in August 2004.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into an armed robbery in which masked gunmen tied up employees at an armoured-truck depot and fled with $18.9million.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA's cruelty investigators are called to an affluent suburb in the Houston area to rescue horses from a property. However, for some animals, help has come too late.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristin wants to find a rock 'n' roll wedding dress, while Amber has two priorities - an outfit that is different and which shows off her tattoos.
